012package org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation;
013
014import java.sql.Connection;
015import static java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection;
016import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
017import java.sql.ResultSet;
018import java.sql.Savepoint;
019import java.sql.Statement;
020import java.sql.SQLException;
021
022import java.util.Iterator;
023
024import java.util.stream.Stream;
025
026import org.postgresql.pljava.ResultSetProvider;
027
028import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function;
029import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
030import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLType;
031
032/**
033 * Functions to check that allocations are being made in the "upper" memory
034 * context as necessary when SPI has been used.
035 */
036public class MemoryContexts {
037    private MemoryContexts()
038    {
039    }
040
041    private static Connection ensureSPIConnected() throws SQLException
042    {
043        Connection c = getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
044        try ( Statement s = c.createStatement() )
045        {
046            s.execute("UPDATE javatest.foobar_1 SET stuff = 'a' WHERE FALSE");
047        }
048        return c;
049    }
050
051    /**
052     * Return an array result after connecting SPI, to ensure the result isn't
053     * allocated in SPI's short-lived memory context.
054     */
055    @Function(schema = "javatest")
056    public static String[] nonSetArrayResult() throws SQLException
057    {
058        ensureSPIConnected();
059        return new String[] { "Hello", "world" };
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * Return a coerced result after connecting SPI, to ensure the result isn't
064     * allocated in SPI's short-lived memory context.
065     *<p>
066     * The mismatch of the Java type {@code int} and the PostgreSQL type
067     * {@code numeric} forces PL/Java to create a {@code Coerce} node applying
068     * a cast, the correct allocation of which is tested here.
069     */
070    @Function(schema = "javatest", type = "numeric")
071    public static int nonSetCoercedResult() throws SQLException
072    {
073        ensureSPIConnected();
074        return 42;
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Return a composite result after connecting SPI, to ensure the result
079     * isn't allocated in SPI's short-lived memory context.
080     */
081    @Function(schema = "javatest", out = { "a text", "b text" })
082    public static boolean nonSetCompositeResult(ResultSet out)
083    throws SQLException
084    {
085        ensureSPIConnected();
086        out.updateString(1, "Hello");
087        out.updateString(2, "world");
088        return true;
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Return a fixed-length base UDT result after connecting SPI, to ensure
093     * the result isn't allocated in SPI's short-lived memory context.
094     */
095    @Function(schema = "javatest")
096    public static ComplexScalar nonSetFixedUDTResult() throws SQLException
097    {
098        ensureSPIConnected();
099        return new ComplexScalar(1.2, 3.4, "javatest.complexscalar");
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * Return a composite UDT result after connecting SPI, to ensure
104     * the result isn't allocated in SPI's short-lived memory context.
105     */
106    @Function(schema = "javatest")
107    public static ComplexTuple nonSetCompositeUDTResult() throws SQLException
108    {
109        Connection c = ensureSPIConnected();
110        try (
111            Statement s = c.createStatement();
112            ResultSet r = s.executeQuery(
113                "SELECT CAST ( '(1.2,3.4)' AS javatest.complextuple )")
114        )
115        {
116            r.next();
117            return r.getObject(1, ComplexTuple.class);
118        }
119    }
120
121    /**
122     * Return a set-of (non-composite) result after connecting SPI, to ensure
123     * the result isn't allocated in SPI's short-lived memory context.
124     */
125    @Function(schema = "javatest")
126    public static Iterator<String> setNonCompositeResult()
127    {
128        final Iterator<String> it = Stream.of("a", "b", "c").iterator();
129        return new Iterator<>()
130        {
131            @Override
132            public boolean hasNext()
133            {
134                try
135                {
136                    ensureSPIConnected();
137                    return it.hasNext();
138                }
139                catch ( SQLException e )
140                {
141                    throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage(), e);
142                }
143            }
144
145            @Override
146            public String next()
147            {
148                try
149                {
150                    ensureSPIConnected();
151                    return it.next();
152                }
153                catch ( SQLException e )
154                {
155                    throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage(), e);
156                }
157            }
158        };
159    }
160
161    /**
162     * Return a set-of composite result after connecting SPI, to ensure
163     * the result isn't allocated in SPI's short-lived memory context.
164     */
165    @Function(schema = "javatest", out = {"a text", "b text"})
166    public static ResultSetProvider setCompositeResult()
167    {
168        return new ResultSetProvider.Large()
169        {
170            @Override
171            public boolean assignRowValues(ResultSet out, long currentRow)
172            throws SQLException
173            {
174                ensureSPIConnected();
175                if ( currentRow > 2 )
176                    return false;
177                out.updateString(1, "a");
178                out.updateString(2, "b");
179                return true;
180            }
181
182            @Override
183            public void close()
184            {
185            }
186        };
187    }
188
189    /**
190     * Prepare a statement after connecting SPI and use it later, to ensure
191     * important allocations are not in SPI's short-lived memory context.
192     */
193    @Function(schema = "javatest", out = {"a text", "b text"})
194    public static ResultSetProvider preparedStatementContext()
195    throws SQLException
196    {
197        Connection c = ensureSPIConnected();
198        final PreparedStatement ps = c.prepareStatement(
199            "SELECT " +
200            " to_char( " +
201            "  extract(microseconds FROM statement_timestamp()) % 3999, " +
202            "  ?)");
203        ps.setString(1, "RN");
204
205        return new ResultSetProvider.Large()
206        {
207            @Override
208            public boolean assignRowValues(ResultSet out, long currentRow)
209            throws SQLException
210            {
211                ensureSPIConnected();
212                if ( currentRow > 2 )
213                    return false;
214                try ( ResultSet rs = ps.executeQuery() )
215                {
216                    rs.next();
217                    out.updateString(1, rs.getString(1));
218                    ps.setString(1, "RN");
219                    return true;
220                }
221            }
222
223            @Override
224            public void close()
225            {
226            }
227        };
228    }
229}
